p: Two categories of polyphenols of jujube peel, free phenols, and bond phenols, were assessed regarding their cardioprotective activity in ISO-induced heart injury in rats. Both types of phenols demonstrated prophylactic antioxidant properties and modulatory effects on different cardiac ion channels with no significant difference between the two polyphenol categories ( Cheng et al., 2012). Jujuboside A, another major triterpenoid of this plant, has represented in vitro cardioprotection via regulating of the PI3K/AKT/mTOR autophagic pathway ( Han et al., 2016).
